Key Arguments: The bill threatens democracy by potentially limiting free and open dialogue.
There is a lack of trust in government, and the bill could exacerbate this issue.
The exemption of government communications from the bill is seen as a move towards authoritarianism.
Open conversations and citizen involvement are preferred methods for addressing misinformation and disinformation.
Notable Quotes: Trust in all levels of Government is at an all-time low and therefore a bill filtering what we listen to with Government communications exemption from this Bill indicates a desire to destroy Democracy and herald in Authoritarian Dystopian nightmare.
Change will only occur at grass-root levels, from neighbours looking into each otherâ€™s eyes, hearing their stories and trying (as much as possible) to walk a mile in the other mans shoes.
